thread.title: Job creation index stays at record-high in June
thread.title_full: Job creation index stays at record-high in June

author: rshabad@thehill.com (Rebecca Shabad)
title: Job creation index stays at record-high in June
text:
Job creation index stays at record-high in June Getty Images By Rebecca Shabad - 07/01/15 05:50 PM EDT 
Job creation remained at a record-high in June, according to a survey released Wednesday by Gallup. 
The Job Creation Index received a +32 rating last month, the poll found, matching the level in May. 
Forty-three percent of workers said their employer is hiring more workers and expanding their workforce, with 11 percent saying their employer is letting workers go and reducing the size of the workforce. ADVERTISEMENT Thirty-nine percent, meanwhile, said the size of their workforce is not changing. 
Gallup’s index in May set a record-high since it began tracking this measurement in 2008 when the recession hit. 
In January 2008, the index received a +26 rating, but dropped to -5 by early 2009. It later reached a high of +30 last September. 
Last month’s survey found the index measured at +27 in the East, +36 in the Midwest, +33 in the West and +30 in the South.
